Posts.Content: May 30, 2012 06:47PM bithoo wrote: I'm sure you're right that it's unprofessional...  but after the MRI and ultrasound, the radiologist came in and spoke to me, and the tech followed me to the dressing room to say "if he's really worried, he'll ask you if you have a surgeon, and will say you should have the biopsy done right away.  He didn't say either, so don't worry."  Of course I worry anyway...  but am kind of grateful to the tech for bothering!
Posts.Title: awaiting biopsy results - "smooth borders" bithoo bithoo

Posts.Content: bithoo wrote: After hearing from both lab techs after a "screening MRI" (high risk) and ultrasound that "it has smooth edges and doesn't look like cancer to me," was discouraged to hear the doc tell me she really had no idea...  of course, she's probably just being careful, but still...  everything I read suggests that a small lump with smooth borders that's not connected to the chest wall is likely B-9 - fibroadenoma or some such...  your thoughts?  Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: awaiting biopsy results - "smooth borders" bithoo bithoo
